data.title: nounspace
data.description:
nounspace is a nounish Farcaster client inspired by the customizability of MySpace.

[![vid1](https://nounspace.mypinata.cloud/ipfs/QmXeJwiPq2oyi7Nospvimm5HZibh8HxJUVdBrxQagTqeHT "https://vimeo.com/973566244")](https://vimeo.com/973566244)

Users can customize the look, feel, and sound of their Space and Homebase using Themes, and can even customize the content and functionality using a growing library of Fidgets.



Spaces on nounspace are the ultimate platform for both users and communities to share the content, functionality, and vibes they wish with their audience.



On the flip side, homebases are the ultimate platform for users and communities to explore the onchain universe, creating custom dashboards of the content, functionality, and vibes to define their own experience.



As a feature-packed client on top of the decentralized social network, Farcaster, users and communities can discover and engage with each other seamlessly without needing to hop between multiple apps.



We're building the future of social, and as such, we believe the only way to do this is as an open-source, community-owned public good. $SPACE is the governance and utility token for nounspace, and the fair launch commenced on June 14, 2024. You can participate in the fair launch by depositing stETH on space.nounspace.com, earn $SPACE each block, and withdraw your stETH anytime after the initial 7-day delay.
data.problem: Social media is rigid and monolithic. Further, lots of content that users and communities create or use is disconnected from social media (ie. websites, applications, community chat, governance).
data.solution: Open-source, community-owned, customizable, decentralized social with mini-apps (aka Fidgets).
data.missionSummary: To provide users and communities with the best tools to create, customize, and explore the digital universe.

questions.query: How does your project contribute to the advancement of the Arbitrum ecosystem?

Describe your previous work or plans related to the Arbitrum ecosystem. How does your project strengthen Arbitrum's foundational infrastructure, improve developer efficiency, or accelerate the adoption of novel applications?
questions.explanation:
nounspace is an innovative Farcaster client that offers a growing spectrum of customized experiences to users.

Arbitrum users, community members, builders, delegates, and newbies alike can create the perfect space on Farcaster for sharing their NFTs, music, governance participation, portfolios (of all types), websites, blogs, or anything else they can imagine.
nounspace already offers the following fidgets that support Arbitrum:
Snapshot - full support for participating in governance for any Arbitrum DAOs that use SnapShot
Frame - full support for adding and using any Frame that supports Arbitrum
iFrame - embed entire websites or applications from the Arbitrum ecosystem (projects with strict security policies that disallow iFrames may need to whitelist nounspace). Example #1: https://bridge.arbitrum.io/ works out of the box. Example #2: any projects participating in the Gitcoin rounds can embed their project’s page on Gitcoin and accept donations directly from their space.

We will add support for Arbitrum to the following Fidgets:

- Support music NFTs on Arbitrum One in the global music player.
 - Support displaying NFTs on Arbitrum One in Gallery Fidget.

nounspace provides an innovative platform for Arbitrum users to create and customize their spaces on Farcaster, enhancing their interaction with the Arbitrum network.

nounspace offers developers tools to build mini-apps, known as Fidgets, that can be used within the platform. It is compatible with frames and aims to integrate any new popular features from the Farcaster ecosystem.

questions.query: If applicable, describe how your project leverages Stylus or Arbitrum Orbit Chains. What unique capabilities or use cases does this enable?
questions.explanation:
while nounspace itself hasn't deployed any contracts on Arbitrum Stylus or Orbit chains, the iFrame fidget enables users to embed and interact with entire websites or applications throughout the Arbitrum ecosystem (projects with strict security policies that disallow iFrames may need to whitelist nounspace). 
We're working working on an SDK to make it easier for builders from the Arbitrum ecosystem to develop their own Fidgets too.

questions.query: Describe your team's expertise in your chosen focus area within the Arbitrum ecosystem. Include relevant experience, publications, or past projects.
questions.explanation:
Willy Ogorzały,- Product Manager 
- Serial founder with 11 years of experience building, leading, and memeing.
- Full-time web3 since 2017. 2 exits.
- Led product and co-led launch of 3 blossoming DAOs: ShapeShift, Giveth, and TrashNFTs.
- Head of Decentralization for Fox Foundation (part time)

Jesse Paterson, aka realitvcrafter.eth - Engineer
Multidisciplinary UX engineer with front-end engineering, product design, user research, and web3 development expertise.
Founding member of ATX DAO and seasoned developer in augmented and virtual reality. 
https://www.nounspace.com/s/realitycrafter.eth

Hypocrisy - Engineer
https://warpcast.com/hypocrisy 

Ryan Norton - Engineer
https://www.nounspace.com/s/ryannorton

Cameron Bodenstadt - Growth
https://warpcast.com/cameronb

questions.query: Project GitHub Repo
Have you participated in a previous Gitcoin Grants Round? If so, please name the rounds or link the builder profile associated with previous rounds.
Provide a brief overview of your tool, library, or framework. What specific problem or inefficiency in the development process does it address?
questions.explanation:
nounspace enables builders to customize their Farcaster profile with content and functionality from outside of social via a growing library of mini-apps called Fidgets.

Developers can also add their own Fidgets, and we're working on a Fidget SDK to make this even easier.

https://docs.nounspace.com/nounspace-alpha

questions.query: How does your project reduce development barriers, improve efficiency, or enhance the security of Web3 projects? Please provide specific examples or metrics if available.
questions.explanation: Fidgets lower the barrier to deploying apps while also giving developers access to a growing userbase of early adopters

questions.query: Outline your project's roadmap and how the grant funds will be used to achieve your development goals.
questions.explanation:
Tentative Roadmap
When building nounspace v0, we chose to concentrate on our key differentiators - the unique features and capabilities of nounspace that set it apart from other clients. Since launching alpha, we've been catching up on the core features that users of Farcaster or any social network come to expect, such as Search, Notifications, and improvements to the Feed and Casting UX. We also addressed user feedback, squashed bugs, and added some key Fidgets: Video, Links, Swap, SnapShot, and RSS.

We look forward to continuing to build upon this solid foundation one step at a time until we achieve our mission.

Ultimately the nounspace team's roadmap will be agile, flexible, and guided by user feedback and the results of ongoing experiments. Here are some of the ideas we're tentatively planning or considering based on the feedback we've received thus far:

Bug fixes + Polish + Improvements

First and foremost, we look forward to improving the app based on feedback from nounspace’s growing userbase and community. We’ve already received some great feedback and bug reports from community members and shipped dozens of fixes and improvements, and look forward to continuing this trend. 

Native iOS and Mobile apps

We’ve already invested a lot of thought into nounspace’s mobile UX, and have clears plans to enable the full suite of nounspace functionality on mobile, including theme customization, fidget configuration, fidget usage, and core farcaster functionality in a cohesive experience that’s easy, accessible, and fun. We have the backend, mockups, and team ready to make this a reality, as well as users that are already attempting to use and requesting nounspace on mobile. 

Channels

 Enable channel owners to customize the space for their channel with music, themes, fidgets, and tabs. We have some exciting ideas for how to make nounspace the best place to manage, apply to (see upcoming changes to channels), or participate in channels, but the first milestone is to ship the core MLP feature and bring the power of Fidgets & customization to Farcaster channels.

 View spec

Proactive Space & Homebase Customization
With each new user that customizes their space, the nounspace network grows in value. Thanks to the rich data available from Farcaster's Social Graph and the corresponding onchain history for each user, nounspace can kickstart these network effects by programatically adding and configuring Fidgets on user's spaces and homebases before they ever log in. This flattens the learning curve and creates a magical onboarding experience for new users by providing immediate value.  

Direct Messages
 We look forward to implementing Farcaster DMs as soon as they're supported on the protocol.  

Smart URLs
By enabling sharing themes, fidgets, and/or tabs via URLs, we can empower both users and their communities to quickly and easily share the magic of nounspace with one another.

Smart URLs serve multiple purposes that are core to nounspace’s strategy to provide the best platform for users and communities to both explore the online universe as well as share the look, sound, content, and functionality they wish with their audiences. Further, we can maximize the virality of this strategy by displaying results publicly and rewarding successful creators, referrers, and communities with $SPACE.

Smart Contract Fidget
Read from or write to any function on any contract. With a simple, no-code UX for creating, customizing, and sharing smart contract data and interactions via Fidgets, nounspace is not only a website builder, but a dapp builder. Not only do we need this ourselves for contract interactions related to $SPACE (ie. approving and staking stETH or $SPACE, claiming $SPACE rewards), but it's yet another infinitely powerful Fidget that can benefit any user or project that utilizes smart contracts.


Fidget SDK, smart contracts, developer experience, review process, and marketplace

Enable developers to quickly and easily build and deploy fidgets in a way that’s both flexible and secure. Because nounspace is basically composed entirely of fidgets, getting this part right is essential. We’ve drafted the architecture as well as the factory contract for deploying, using, and updating Fidgets. We did this in collaboration with Morpheus, who had already started working on a spec for “Non Fungible Agents” when we realized we had the technically-identical goal give users to access to an infinite library of flexible, permissionless, and secure third-party apps. This is a huge win-win, not only enabling interoperability between Fidgets and Agents (ability to use agents deployed in the Morpheus ecosystem alongside fidgets on nounspace), but also saving development costs for both projects and resulting in recurring revenues for nounspace in the form of MOR emissions to code contributors. If you’re a developer excited to build fidgets, stay tuned for the Fidget SDK and join the #fidget-devs channel in our discord server in the meantime.

data.description: Gitcoin creates solutions that empower digitally native communities to fund, build, and protect what matters.

Link to your Public Group Chat
Have you participated in a previous Gitcoin Grants Round? If so, please name the rounds or link the builder profile associated with previous rounds.
How does your project contribute to the growth of the OSS ecosystem? Please provide specific examples of how your application enhances or expands the current ecosystem.
questions.explanation: both nounspace and our agentic CEO, nounspaceTom, are fully open source under the GPL-3.0 license. contributors to nounspace's open source repositories can earn points for their contributions on https://scoutgame.xyz

questions.query: What features or use cases does your dApp/App present? How is it differentiated?
questions.explanation: nounspace's core features of Themes, Fidgets (mini apps), and Tabs enable users (including projects, communities, tokens, etc.) to fully customize the look, sound, content, and functionality of their spaces and homebases. This makes it easy for any user to share whatever content and functionality is important to them in a single place, whether that content lives on a social network or beyond.

questions.query: What are your plans for further development, and how will the grant funds be used to achieve these goals?
questions.explanation: Currently we're working on mobile and FrameV2 (Farcaster mini apps) support. Next, our goal is to enable any community to easily deploy their own whitelabeled version of nounspace, homepage, with custom domain, branding, directory of members, notifications, and/or default spaces + homebases, including themes, fidgets (including all FrameV2s), tabs, and fidget settings.
